intro: Echioides annua, commonly known as the annual echium, is an herbaceous plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Echioides annua is an annual species, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
